author: _shemnon
content: P2P don't hash over the compressed form.  It's uncompressed before it's decoded.

author: lightclient
content: true but does that mean that the go snappy lib will happily decompress the java libs form (if hypothetically, it doesnt match its own)?

author: _shemnon
content: Yes.  It has a non-deterministic encoding but a deterministic decoding.

author: _shemnon
content: Even if the algorithms produced the same encoding, if an alternate but legal encoding exists  (even if less-efficient) it shouldn't be hashed over.

author: lightclient
content: i guess we'll have to hash the decompressed value

author: _shemnon
content: These sorts of malleability attacks caused (still cause?) problems in bitcoin.
